channel.title: Merry Christmas
channel.description:
Merry Christmas and a happy new year to everyone in the moparscape/silab community have a great time this holiday and be safe. Im going to leave mopar just for a bit since I lost a bit of interest but have a great time. I will most likley be playing my PS3/call of duty 4 for most of the holidays .
Goodbye happy holidays and be safe
:) Thankyou :)

item.title: Merry Christmas
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Buzzy, don’t think you’re so superior because you know that Christian holidays are timed with pagan holidays. It was intentional, so it would be an easy transition for pagans to Christianity in the Roman Empire. That doesn’t mean Christianity isn’t unique nor true.

Read full topic

item.title: Merry Christmas
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:29, topic:166327”][quote author=xxlegitxx link=topic=225505.msg1944357#msg1944357 date=1198296783]

Christians get their panties in a twist over me talking about and celebrating my religion, so why shouldn’t I do the same?

Don’t think so highly of yourself that Christians would actually care about your salvation. Christmas is barely Christian, so there’s no point in discussing your anti-Chrisitanity views here.
[/quote]just because 99% of christians are ignorant morons doesnt mean they all are, some may listen to him

[quote author=xxlegitxx link=topic=225505.msg1944274#msg1944274 date=1198295518]
A simple Christmas topic degenerates into flaming. Good job, douche bags.
[/quote]stop crying because you got flamed for posting your college acceptance letter[/quote]

…wait a second… They’re letting non-ignorant people join christianity? When the fuck did this start happening? Any fucking idiot that does any type of research can tell you that Christ is just a duplicate of tons of other “saviors”, and the two top christian holidays, have virtually NOTHING to do with christianity, but are in fact pagan.

Just to give examples on the current holiday:

[ul][li]Mistletoe- The white berries of mistletoe were believed by pagans to represent droplets of the semen of the sun god.[/li]
[li]Timing- Anybody who knows christian theology well enough to have an intelligent conversation will tell you that jesus was actually born in the spring judging by the way they described the setting. The setting was made to wipe out the pagan holiday yule (the 21st) or better known as the winter solstice or equinox. Or, if you want to go to more recent and modern settings, the actual date of December 25th was chosen because of the rebirth of the roman sun god, Saturn, and anyone who knows roman mythology will tell you that, December 25th was the holiday known as Saturnalia, or better known as a gay sex orgy.[/li]
[li]The tree- In Germany, the evergreen tree was used in worship and celebration of the yule god, also in observance of the resurrected sun god.[/li][/ul]

I won’t even begin to get into the use of the yule log, or the use of holly. You can find all of this simply by reading your bible.

Lin, this post wasn’t to flame your thread, but instead just to shed some light.

Read full topic
